requirements.summary: Provide a single repo-level command (via a frontend-hosted script) that exports the full project source (frontend + backend) into a deterministic ZIP, excluding dependency and build artifact folders.
acceptanceCriteria: A single command is documented and available (e.g., via an npm script or shell script) that produces a .zip file containing the project source code.
The ZIP archive includes the backend and frontend source directories and any required configuration files needed to rebuild the project.
The ZIP archive excludes at minimum: node_modules/, .dfx/, dist/build output folders, and .git/ (if present).
The generated ZIP filename and output location are deterministic (same name and folder each time), and the command prints the output path on completion.

file_operations.description: Create a Python-based export utility that zips the entire repository source (including ../backend and ../frontend when invoked from the script location), writes to a deterministic path (e.g., frontend/export/project-source.zip), excludes dependency/build/artifact folders (node_modules/, .dfx/, dist/, build/, .git/), and prints the final ZIP output path on success.

Create a shell wrapper command that can be run from the repository root (e.g., bash frontend/scripts/export-project.sh), resolves the repo root reliably, invokes frontend/scripts/export_project.py, ensures the output directory exists, and echoes the deterministic ZIP output path upon completion.

Document the single command to generate the ZIP export, the deterministic output location/filename, and the exclusion rules (node_modules/, .dfx/, dist/build output, .git/). Ensure all user-facing text is in English.
